column4: hello. i'm trying to run alien arena (the version from getdeb) and i get the following error: "AL lib: oss.c:179: Could not open /dev/dsp: Device or resource busy" - anyone have any ideas how to get past that?
launch it like this « padsp alienarena »
that made a difference - but it's still not running. get the same errors as before except the one i quoted earlier isn't there. "bt_audio_service_open: connect() failed: Connection refused (111)"
then i really dunno see here maybe http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1290700
prename 's/\.old/\.new/'  donkey*.old
if number is a single digit or two you can use ? or ?? instead of the broader *
that didn't work
make a test with a copy of some files so you are sure it does the right thing
even
it worked here
mkdir tmp/ && touch  tmp/donkey{0..99}.old && ls tmp/* && prename 's/\.old/\.new/'  donkey*.old && ls tmp/*
thanks but it's done - why the /tmp/ stuff anyways?
it was just a test to show you that it really works
i created a folder tmp/ full of files named lioke yoursa and renamed them
100 files to be exact
a little bit excessive? :)
ubuntu 9.10 ?
further help in #ubuntu+1
i could compile from source... :)
finding a deb. (even third party) is allways a prefered option.
first hit in the ppa search page https://launchpad.net/~mozillateam/+archive/thunderbird-stable
hope it has it :)
then i dunno; maybe you just have to wait a few days
